Name: Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo
Description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game about Moto GP of early '70.
From rules:
At the game can participate from 2 to 5 competitors.
The entire route is divided into 25 fractions by 10 km each. Players will proceed on the track throwing the dice, whose numbers indicate the gear on the vehicle, 6 indicates a stop (not moving).
Before you start you have put along the track the employees to pit which will, to player who stops in the vicinity, the chances of mechanical failure to his bike.
The "Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo"will be held in several Grands Prix each of which will be ongoing in the 125cc category (will be held at 1 lap), 350cc (to be played in 2 turns) and 500cc (to be played in 3 rounds).

Name: Ach Du Lieber Biber
Description:
In Ach Du Lieber Biber, beavers are surfing the waves of the icy river towards the waterfall, but while they do so, they have to beware of the floating junk and other surfers. The player who lets the fewest beavers tip over the waterfall wins the game.

In more detail, the players place the water cylinders on the river and randomly organize the surfing beavers and junk markers on top of them. They take turns rolling a "surfing die" to determine whether they have to progress the water level, with the aid of a wooden lodge across the river, towards the edge of the waterfall.

Name: Scoutspelet
Description:
This is a pretty blatant (and surely unlicensed) ripoff of Trivial Pursuit.

Everything in the game revolves around scouting. The categories are "Lord & Lady Baden-Powell", "International", "Events and places", "Swedish history and now", and "Literature and misc".  Players roll dice to move pawns around the board and ask questions related to the category-space upon which they land.  The goal of the game is to get point-pieces by landing on the prime space for the category and correctly answering a question in that category.  The goal is to get point-pieces in all of the categories and then answer a final quesion from a category chosen by the opponents.

Name: Harbinger
Description:
A cooperative or competitive fantasy role-playing board game, the goal of which is to bring about or stop the Armageddon that will destroy the kingdom.  The alignment of the characters chosen determines if the players will fight for or against the Great Evil that threatens to destroy the land.

Players explore the modular map board, revealing tiles as they go.  Gameplay is primarily driven through adventure cards in which monsters are fought, treasure is found, quests are solved, and clues are uncovered that can narrow down the identity of the Great Evil.  The climax of the game occurs when the identity of the Great Evil is revealed and the final battle is fought which will determine the fate of the Kingdom.

Name: Fibonacci's Trump
Description:
Fibonacci's Trump is a basic trump/trick-taking card game.

Collect tricks through playing cards depending on the color that is led, using the trump color when able. Points are determined by the symbols on the cards: the number of the symbols that is the same as the Symbol Indicator collected determines how many points you are awarded each round.

Scoring uses Fibonacci's numbers... so the more symbols you collect, the better off you are.

First player to 144 wins.

Name: Der Mueller
Description:
From the back of the box:

Nestled deep in the Black Forest of Bavaria lay the town of Shoental. Although the villagers worked hard, the village remained in poverty, because the domination of the dragon Gruenaugen. Gruenaugen demanded half of all goods produced by the village, or the villagers would face destruction from the dragon's wrath. Many a young lad had set forth to slay the dragon, never to return.

The young town miller (der Mueller) spent many hours thinking about the plight of his town. He knew that previous attempts to destroy the dragon by force had been fruitless. He also knew that Gruenaugen loved games, as all dragons feel they are intellectually superior. He invented a game that only the cleverest would win and confronted the dragon with a deal: freedom of the village if der Mueller won, or enslavement of der Mueller if Gruenaugen won. Gruenaugen, feeling he was superior, naturally accepted.

Der Mueller facest the hardest test of his life but overwhelmed the dragon with his strategy and won. Der Mueller returned to the village a hero. Gruenaugen was never seen again.

A strategy game for two players. The object of the game is to capture 5 of your opponent's gems. Each player starts with 8 gems and tries to complete trios to capture theur opponent's gems by placing their gems on the board during phase one, sliding their gems during phase two, and picking up and moving their gems during phase three.

Re-Implements:

Nine Men's Morris

Name: X vs Y
Description: This is a trivia game of men versus women in which all the questions are based around gender and have numerical responses.  Each team answers questions about the opposite gender in regards to love, life, work, appearance, etc.  Women could be asked: What percent of men report cheating on their taxes? Men could be asked: On average, how many pairs of shoes does a woman own? Teams attempt to place several cards in order from least to greatest based upon their guessed answers. Packaged inside is an electronic card scanner with automatic scoring (no more cheating here) and an adjustable volume. This electronic base communicates with players throughout the game, so there is no need for an instruction booklet.

Name: Rat Zvijezda
Description:
Rat Zvijezda (Star Wars) is croatian published game which puts the players in the role of Imperator {Emperor Palpatine}, Darth Vader, Han Solo or Luke Skywalker.
Each character controls one of the powers from the last three parts of Star Wars trilogy - Imperial Fleet (Imperator) and Death Star (Vader) vs. Millenium Eagle {Millenium Falcon} (Solo) and Hoth (Luke).

Armies are composed of fighter squadrons, foot soldiers, cannons and famous allies from series. Combat is conducted primarily through series of dogfights and landing and invading opponent bases. Of course, force duels are present as well.

Name: Snack Factory
Description:
Donuts, chocolate, and chips!

In Snack Factory it’s up to you to keep the world supplied with their favorite snacks. In each round you will need to balance profit and sales while maximizing productivity to stay ahead of the competition.

Think you have what it takes? Reach for a delicious snack and try your hand at running the best snack factory!

Snack Factory incorporates a climbing style card game with clever scoring mechanics to give players interesting and challenging decisions!

(Publisher Blurb)

Name: Audubonopoly
Description: It's Monopoly with the theme of the town of Audubon NJ.  The game use local stores on the game board.The game was a fundraiser fo the local sports teams,  The Green Wave.

Name: Dédalo
Description:
In this game two armies clash and the only thing that will discourage them is the fact of losing their king in battle. All the king’s men will fight to death for him, regardless of the fact that even the king is a fierce fighter.
This last battle takes place in a very strange land, long tunnels that are always changing to confuse anyone that wanders in them.

With similar mechanics as in “NiMeMo” you have to move your army around the board and try to eliminate your opponent’s pieces by blocking them.
As soon as you eliminate the other’s king you win.

Dédalo (in Spanish) comes from Daedalus. In Greek mythology Daedalus was a skilful craftsman and artisan. The Labyrinth on Crete was created by him.
So as in this game we have an ever-changing labyrinth I decided to give it Daedalus’ name on his honour.

Name: Shinsengumi: Ikedaya-sodo
Description:
English and Korean rules available.
https://legalalien.sakura.ne.jp/wiki/?Tabletop+Wargaming/Shinsengumi+Ikedaya+Incident+English+Rules
https://legalalien.sakura.ne.jp/wiki/?%ED%83%81%EC%83%81+%EC%9B%8C%EA%B2%8C%EC%9E%84/%EC%8B%A0%EC%84%A0%EC%A1%B0+%EC%9D%B4%EC%BC%80%EB%8B%A4%EC%95%BC+%EC%86%8C%EB%8F%99+%ED%95%9C%EA%B8%80%EB%A3%B0

On June 8th, 1864, in Kyoto, there was a very famous sword-action between Shinsengumi and Kinnoh-rohshi.  Yes, it was Ikedaya.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikedaya_Incident

It was rumored that the most radical group of Kinnoh-rohshi had planned to kidnap Komei-emperor from Kyoto while they set up fires around Kyoto-city.
Shinsengumi, the patrol group hired by Edo-bakuhu decided to assault the Kinnoh-rohshi's meeting before the final moment.  They found the meeting at Ikedaya.

This is a small postcard game.  It was distributed on A-game shop's yearend-yearopening campaign between 2009 and 2010.
Basically this game uses the same game engine as 47 Ronin.  Each player take action by one of his stack alternatively.  Each stack can move and then fight to adjacent enemy stack.  This is chess-like puzzle movement.  A goes to attack B to open the path.  But, the enemy moves C to defend the path just opened.  And so on.
Also, if you have issue #1 of Wargame Japanese History, you can use counters from Shinsengumi Chronicle for this game.

Though this is a small game, it is filled with puzzle-like tactics and excitement of swordplay.

updated
This game is reprinted as a second game of Wargame Japanese History #27.

Name: Wallis's New Game of Universal History and Chronology
Description:
'Locomotive Game'

This game from 1840 is a reworked issue of the 1814 edition of the game and the central area of the game has been updated to reflect later historical events.

The racing track comprises of 143 circles, starting with Adam & Eve and ending with a railway train.

Name: Circus Train: Expansion Kit
Description:
The Circus Train Expansion Kit includes everything you need to expand the game to accommodate 3, 4 or even 5 players! Strategic planning is even more important as the competition can be fierce. In addition to the new rules for scoring and supporting the new players, the game also includes a new Action card for each player, a new Event card, and lots of new Talent and Performance counters. Four new special characters are also included in the Optional Rules.

Note, the Circus Train Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Circus Train to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:
Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale
Scale: Weekly turns; bi-monthly pay days and one performance city per turn.

Game Components:
• One color Rules sheet
• 24 Action cards
• 5 Overnight Hire cards
• 1 Event card
• 24 Performance counters
• 3 Circus Train markers
• 28 Talent counters
• 6 Victory Point counters
• 9 Best Performance Score counters
• 3 Reputation Value counters
• 3 Two Week Show markers
• 10 Event card support markers

Name: Ladybug Lunch
Description:
It's up to you and your ladybug helper to rid your beautiful flower of those pesky aphids.

In this rummy variant, created for families, players collect different sets of coloured ladybugs. For each set laid, your ladybug is moved to a leaf. All aphids that are on that leaf become ladybug lunch and can be removed from your flower. The first player to rid their flower from all the aphids is the winner!

Name: The Prisoner Game
Description:
publisher description

This tabletop adventure game is based upon the cult 1960's TV series 'The Prisoner'. The series featured 'Number 6' a former secret agent of the British Government during the Cold War, who is never identified by name. After resigning his position he is abducted and held prisoner in a small, isolated eccentric sea-side resort known only as 'The Village'.

'Card- Board Games' is a new and exciting concept in tabletop adventure games play. From a simple pack of cards you are able to build up a unique playing area from the centre of your dining table. Since the cards are laid strategically then each game you play will be different and pose new challenges for you.

A playing piece and a few counters are all you need to start the game. Its your job to move your playing piece along the paths to the outer limits of the board without other players getting in your way. As the game develops you collect additional cards which will either help you on your way or impede the progress of the other players.

Name: Cosmic Goldrush
Description:
Designer comments:
Cosmic Goldrush is a game where players try to mine for gold and platinum on the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. On the always-moving, always-perilous, always-changing belt you got look after your water supplies, as well as yourself. Get stranded too long on an asteroid and you'll find yourself out of the board, quite a lot of poorer than a turn before.

Mine, trade, buy stuff, bug your friends and visit the infamous Space saloon for more new stuff.

Name: Virus Wars
Description:
Virus Wars is a two-player ancient board game that simulates an evolution of two colonies of viruses, which are growing and absorbing (zombifying) each other. The exact origin of the game is unknown but it was actively played as a paper-and-pencil game in Saint Petersburg State University in 80s. There were several variants of the game with slightly different rules.

Players must make five steps per turn. Each step is either placing a new virus on the board or "zombifying" one of the enemy viruses. The goal of the game is to leave the opponent without legal moves.

Name: Undead Avenue
Description:
The Front Cover Caption:

The Zombie War Skirmish Miniatures Game

Publisher Web Site Blurb:

Undead Avenue is a new take on the classic "escape from the city" urban Zombie Apocalypse story. You start in a section of downtown sealed off in all directions, maybe by accident, maybe because the government or the police or the National Guard doesn't want anyone, or anything escaping.

Unfortunately that includes you.

Choose your character type and begin your search for weapons,
equipment, allies, and most importantly, a way out. The game has
been designed for individual human miniatures to attempt to escape a zombie infected city. While it can be played as a standalone game, it can also be used as a prelude to the miniatures wargame Undead States of America.

Name: Undead Nations
Description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Global Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

While the focus of the core rulebook, Undead States of America, was obviously the United States and North America, the Zombie War is a global one.

This expansion of the basic rules provides new types of terrain for the campaign games, including deserts, swamps, jungles, dense urban populations, and radioactive wastelands.

It also includes detailed maps and rule modifications for other regions on the planet and how to fight the Zombie War raging across the world.

Name: Undead Universe
Description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Historic Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

Undead Universe takes a look at the smaller zombie outbreaks throughout time, allowing the players to recreate those earlier battles and playing out the potential undead wars in the past and future.

Undead Universe is intended to be used as an expansion to the core rulebook, Undead States of America. It contains guidelines for zombie wars and outbreaks against ancient armies, medieval armies, the armies of muskets and early rifles, armies in the two World Wars (Nazi Zombies!), and fictional cyberized or powered armor armies of the far future. This book revises how to do the Short Campaign Game in different eras, and introduces a new campaign game where a player fights each major zombie outbreak in history and into the future.

Name: Labyrinthine
Description:
User summary: One player is the Evil Wizard. The Evil Wizard may arrange the sections of the gameboard, representing rooms and hallways, in any way desired. The Evil Wizard places the Princess in the last room. The player(s) representing the questing party wins the game if the Princess can escape from the Evil Wizard. The Evil Wizard player wins by destroying the questing party.

See also Labyrinthine

Name: Greyhound Racing
Description:
A game made in England in the 1950's. There is no publisher listed on the game box. It is a very simple roll and move game on a board with a serpentine track that goes from the start (0) to the finish line (100).
 A six is needed to start the race and an exact roll is needed to hit the finish line. There are many penalty spaces on the board that will stop you or move you back. there are some bonus spaces which move you ahead or give you an extra die roll.
 It comes in a simple cardboard box with the 5 sentence rules glued to the inside top cover lid. The tri-fold board is ~ 16" x 10" when unfolded. There are 4 different colored plastic greyhounds for pawns. A small plastic die tumbler and die are also included.

Name: Muselabyrinten
Description:
The first player who make it through the rotating maze, and  with all of his four mouses reaches the tasty cheese in the middle wins the game.

from a merged entry
A clever and fun little game. The maze is a labyrinth with a clear plastic film that you can turn in order to change the maze. Every player has 4 mice each to control and the goal is to get them from their nests to the middle, where the cheese is. The players roll a dice every turn, and the plastic film on top of the maze is moved that many steps, thus changing the layout.

Name: Growling Tigers under Siege: Defense of Changde 1943
Gulp!
Description:
(User Summary.)

Gulp! is a simple card game, in the fashion of War.  The cards describe a variety of marine life, and list the other cards that can be "eaten".  The set of cards form a partial order:  there are a few unique different apex predators that are eaten by nothing, and several instances of the Phytoplankton card that can be eaten - directly or indirectly - by all other cards.

Players each draw a card from the top of the deck: if one card eats the other, then the player claims both; if neither eat the other (or, rarely, both eat the other) then each chooses an additional card, with the winner of the next pair taking all yet-unclaimed cards.  Most cards at the end of the deck wins.

Name: Scrabble People Letter-Matching Board Game
Description: From the back of the box: Youngsters will enjoy this exciting race game. Players choose a word card from the 18 colorfully illustrated cards in this game and must match letter cards to complete their word. Everytime they spin the spinner and land on a matching colored space, they receive 1, 2 or 3 letter cards. The player who completes his 3 letter word first must then head to Sir Scrabble's castle and receive the gold key to win the game.

Name: By Air To Australia
Description: Roll & Move about the air journey from Croydon Airport England to Charleville Australia with the normal roll & move hazards (Oil Trouble Miss A Turn, Head Wind Throw a 3 Before Proceeding etc)

Name: Poznajemy Kolory
Description:
Poznajemy Kolory is a children's game for 2-4 players, Ages 4 - 8.

This game is a child's introduction to colors.

The game is designed to encourage children to compare and logical thinking.

Players in this game have only one task - they have to identified as soon as possible the colors thrown a pair of colorful dice and associate them with the colors of cardboards on the table, spread cocks. Who will recognize the appropriate colors on the rooster, that puts him on his chip. Very simple rules of the game makes it fun for young and older children and even adults. The youngest learn the recognition and naming colors.

Name: When's in the Bag
Description:
Expansion to Who's In The Bag.This times. Teams of players race against the clock to guess the phrase based on a certain time. "Early in the Morning", "When I'm 64", "Pancake Day" etc...

Over 400 phrases

Name: Where's in the Bag
Description:
Expansion to Who's In The Bag.
Where's in the Bag is an additional set of location cards that you can add to the main game. So aside from having to help your teammates identify famous characters, you'll now have to communicate locations such as "your trouser pocket" and "The Kremlin"

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Return of the Others
Description:
Return of the Others continues the conflict between the Night's Watch and what lives north of The Wall. The Wildling threat has been answered, but the brave men of the Night's Watch are learning that far worse live in the savage wilderness of the north.

Featuring characters like Mance Rayder, Melisandre, Old Bear Mormont, and the legendary Balerion the Black, Return of the Others will bring your A Game of Thrones deck to new heights of conquest and intrigue.

Return of the Others is the sixth installment in the "Defenders of the North" expansion to the A Game of Thrones card game, based on George R.R. Martin's bestselling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. This 40-card pack features 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.

Note: The 2011 edition of Return of the Others has been updated to the sixty-card format (three copies each of twenty unique cards). The included cards are updated with rules text based on the most recent FAQ and Errata.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Fairy Tale (fan expansion for Dominion)
Description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games.

Magic has come to your domain. You knew you were taking a risk when you opened the borders to those magic bean salesmen, but surely hiring the troll to collect tolls on your new bridge was the right move? The old fortune teller who came to your castle that fateful night said that your wishes would come true, and now everything you touch is turning to gold, and your servants seem to have been replaced by walking brooms with arms!

You scoffed when your advisers told you those old wizards were dangerous, but now, with strange lights flashing over the nearby mountains at night, you can't help but wonder if they were right. Will you hire a sorceress to cast spells at your behest, or a huntsman to deal with those mysterious wolves that are plaguing the countryside? Only by wit, courage, and a little hard-earned wisdom will you be able to protect and expand your dominion.

Fairy Tale is a free, unofficial, print-and-play expansion for the game Dominion.
Details and a download can be found below in the files section of this page.

It adds 21 new Kingdom cards to Dominion, including 10 Actions, 2 Treasures, 3 Victory cards, 5 Durations and 1 Reaction. The central theme is cards that do multiple things.

Background
Dominion is designed by Donald X. Vaccarino, and is published in the USA by Rio Grande Games. Fairy Tale is an unofficial fan-made expansion is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games.  Fairy Tale was originally designed by D. Brad Talton, Jr. and after William Stewart offered to help, he passed the project on to him and the BGG community.

Name: Talk in Text
Description:
Talk in Text
The Code Breaking Puzzle Game

Just how well do you know your mobile phone? Talk in Text is a fabulous new code-breaking puzzle game, where players race to decode text message teasers using a numeric keypad. Includes 160 puzzles and four "phones" to help players decipher the codes! For up to 4 players.

(from Mindware.com)

Name: PentaKribb
Description:
PentaKribb is billed as "Boardless Cribbage". Instead of the traditional board, players are provided a scoring sheet to post their hands and scores. Players are not dealt their own, individual hands. Instead, the dealer turns a single card face up. The players enter that card onto their own score sheet, placing it into the square of their choice in a 4 x 5 grid. This is repeated until all 20 spaces are filled in. The dealer then turns over a single cut card. The result is 5 hands of 5 cards for each player. The scores are added up for all the hands. This is repeated for five deals. The highest score at the end of the five deals wins the game.

From published rules on the box.

Name: Stink Fight!
Description:
From the inside of the box of "Leapin' Lemurs" Peanut Butter & Chocolate cereal.

When Ring-tailed Lemurs get mad at each other, sometimes they wipe their scent all over their tails and have a sort of stinky sword fight with them. Seeing as you don't have a tail, this is an easier (and less smelly!) way to have a Stink Fight!

Object: To get your 2 tokens from the START row at the bottom of the board into 2 white spaces in the FINISH row, while avoiding other players or the black 'Aw Stink!' squares.

Components:
7 x 13 board
6 player tokens
Rules
Player provided die

Name: 3singes
Description:
3singes (3monkeys) is a unique party game, as it handicaps the players. It is based on the chinese three monkeys of wisdom.

One player is blind but knows all (with 3 cards) and must tell the mute player how to mime the phrase to the deaf, without saying to the mute what he is miming, but HOW to do it, and the blind cannot see if the mute mime it correctly.

The deaf players (having iPods or similar things) don't hear what the blind is saying, so they must try to understand the blind's message according to the mute's mimes. If a blind player hears a correct element, he indicates the mute a deaf got a good answer and points are scored.

Name: High Frontier Expansion
Description: Expansion to the space exploration game HIGH FRONTIER, adds an extension to the map that includes Jupiter, Saturn, main belt comets, centaurs, and Trojan asteroids. The expanded rules include slingshots, radiation belts, piracy, combat, solar flares, and space politics and governments. There are also 24 new patent cards, representing reactors, generators, and radiators and an additional thruster. The expanded scenarios include alien invasions, the solitaire game, and two short games.

Name: What's In The Bag
Description:
An Expasions to Who's In The Bag
Try to communicate locations such as ‘your trouser pocket ’ and ‘The Kremlin'.

Name: Definity
Description:
This game is available only in Hungarian yet.
The "quizmaster" reads a rarely used word from a card, the other players must write a definition for the word.
The fun of this game is, that usually nobody ever heard these words before. 
When everybody is ready, the quizmaster collects the answers, and together with the correct answer, reads it. The players then vote to the one they thinks is the correct definition.

Name: Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees: A diverting game calculated to kill care and enliven the dreary hours of winter
Description:
This Game, like many others of a similar nature, will shew the variety and innocent amusement that may be derived from a Pack of Cards; were the admirers of them as solicitous to acquire the useful lessons with which they are fraught, as they are to appropriate them to the destruction of each other's fortune, they would soon take precedence of every invention for the exercise of the mind.

Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees, is represented in the centre of the plate which accompanies the Rules. In the corners representations of playing cards - King of Hearts, Queen of Spades, Jack of Clubs, 10 of Diamonds.

Equipment required: pack of playing cards.

Name: British and Foreign Animals
Description:
The game is described as 'designed to allure the minds of youth to an acquaintance with the wonders of nature'. The playing surface has 37 playing spaces each with an animal. The game is played with a teetotum marked on eight sides. The animals featured include the otter, armadillo, beaver, sheep, rat, lynx, monkey and fox. The end of the game is marked by the lion. The game comes with a booklet which describes the animals.

Two or three persons may amuse themselves with this agreeable pastime; and if a double set of counters and pyramids are purchased, six persons may play at it.

Name: Walker's New Geographical Game Exhibiting a Tour Through Europe
Description:
In order to play this European centred race game each player must have a marker, four counters and an eight-sided teetotum. There are 133 playing spaces covering the gameboard. The race begins in London and ends in Athens. A separate booklet sets out the rules. As well as providing information on the history and commerce of the places, the game also encouraged reading and conversational skills.

Published May 1st, 1810.

Name: An historical game of England: The royal generalogical pastime of the sovereigns of England from Egbert to George 3rd
Description:
The game is in the form of a family tree with each monarch named in numbered circles. Those circles before William l are in pink and those after are yellow. Circle one is the DIVISIONS OF THE HISTORY OF ENGLAND, and it leads to Britons, Romans, Saxons and Saxon Heptarchy then Saxon kings, Danish kings, restored Saxon kings, and the various houses from the Normans to the Brunswick.

Published March 10th 1804.

Name: Waterhole
Description:
Waterhole is a co-operative game whereby the aim of the game is to get the herbivores into the waterhole and back to their home territories without any of them being eaten by the carnivores. This game was originally designed to accompany the teaching pack 'Conflict, Change and Our Future'. It was intended for use in schools for children aged between 9 and 13.

Published in Norwich, UK.

Name: The Mount of Knowledge
Description:
The game features a path through a landscape, with small circular pictures showing a wood, a river and other features. The first circle, called the Horn Book, reflects one of the teaching methods of the time. Players must stop here to learn the letters of the alphabet. There are various forfeits and rewards along the way. These include punishments for boasting, wasting time and pride, and rewards for repentance, patience and diligence.

You are to be provided with a Teetotum having 8 sides, marked 1 to 8, and each player with a traveller (marker) and 8 counters of which 4 are to be put into the Pool. The highest spinner begins and to proceed regularly to the right hand.

Name: Sevendeck
Description: The Sevendeck is a deck of playing cards containing seven suits of seven numbers each. The suits are ranked both by color (ROYGBIV) and by the number of angled corners ("points") on their pips. As with a regular deck of playing cards, there are several games that can be played with a Sevendeck, with more on the way. (From publisher web site 7deck.com)

Name: Willy's Walk to see Grandmamma
Description:
A moral race game.

Equipment required: counters of glazed earthenware marked with the letters A to H, teetotum of bone marked with red and black numbers 1 to 6.

Rules:

The game is played with a teetotum and small blocks marked with letters of the alphabet. A player chooses his letter, then spins the teetotum and his block is placed upon the number turned up, of course, according to the directions on the other side. It is best to choose a chairman and allow none to touch the blocks but him. As each player spins, he should call out '6' for 'A' or '2' for 'B' and no persons should spin till the former spinner's move has been made. The coloured squares mark the numbers to which any advantage or disadvantage is attached. If the player makes more than 79, he must count the over plus back - 78,77, and no one is the winner till he has made the exact number.

Name: The royal game of the gathering of nations: Exhibition of the industry of all nations
Description:
Spiral race game with coloured lithographs illustrating various places and industries. It terminates in the centre with a view of the Great Exhibition building.

Published in London.

Name: Royal Geographical Amusement or the Safe and Expeditious Traveller Through all the Parts of Europe by Sea and by Land
Description:
The gameboard showing a map of Europe with the principal and capital cities numbered. Together with printed sheet of rules and descriptive text.

He who has the highest number in spinning the totum, is to begin, and the others are to follow according to their respective numbers. Three Gentlemen or Ladies are supplied to make the tour of Europe. They are represented by the three Turned Pillars, called Travellers, each of the players having one of these, which is to be placed at the stage corresponding to the number turned up. The four counters, of the same colour with the Traveller, are to be employed as Markers, and take the name SERVANTS. The player is to lay down as many of these as he is ordered to wait turns, and when it comes to his turn to spin again, instead of spinning he must take up one Marker, and so on, till they are all taken up.

Published December 1st, 1823.

Name: A New Royal Geographical Pastime for England and Wales
Description:
At the gameboard there are 169 principal and county towns joined by lines. The descriptions and rules on either side of the map list each town and any rewards or forfeits to be made. There are no charges for moving from one place to another. One of the better rewards occurs at Stonehenge 'worthy of visiting without expense, from whence you are to be removed to Chester at 148'. One of the harshest is at Knaresborough, 163, 'which has four medicinal springs of different qualities; to drink from them you must pay 1 counter and are conveyed to Bath, 2'.

The game itself is enlightening, for it not only refers to visiting stately homes, cathedrals, churches and other public buildings but also describes events, folklore, and geographical features such as smuggling, the flitch of bacon given at Dunmow and the Giant's Causeway.

Published June 1st, 1787.

Equipment required: teetotum, ivory pillars (markers), counters

Name: Grandmama's New Game of Natural History
Description: The center of sheet for the board for this game shows an elderly woman seated at a table surrounded by 24 compartments with fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters. There are the same number of cards with these characters together with another 36 cards showing birds and animals printed with descriptions and four lines of verse. Some of these are placed in the compartments. Players take turns to draw the character cards and collect the verse cards from the corresponding compartment. The winner is the player with most verse cards at the end of the game.

Name: Columbia or the Land of the West
Description:
The game begins with the discovery of America by Christopher Columbus in 1492, and ends with the Treaty of Independence of 1782. It can be played either historically or topographically.

There are 36 dated entries in the rules booklet that describe the history of North America and the United States from 1492 to 1782. There is also a list of 38 states and capitals, including six that are Canadian, still British possessions at the time of the game.

Name: The Fancy Bazaar or Aristocratic Traders
Description:
Mainly a card game, with the gameboard being a place to put the counters.

The aim of the Bazaar is fourfold: to aid the Acclimatisation of Society, to help pay the National Debt, to raise a fund to build a bridge from Dover to Calais, and to build a school to teach Grown Children.

The stalls are run as follows: the Fruiterer and Greengrocer is Lady Verysoft, the Grocer is Mrs Plausible, the Pastrycook is Miss Wheedleton, the Toy Dealer is Baroness Goodchild, the Earthenware Dealer is the Duchess of Otherland, the Hosier and Glover is Viscountess Pumicestone, the Poulterer is Miss Silverstone, and the Florist is the Marchioness of Bailbury.

Most of the cards relate to the goods found on these stalls. The players take the part of the various stall holders. The cards are dealt out to the players in turn, who have to follow the instructions of paying counters to the various stalls.

Name: Outward bound or ships and their cargoes
Description:
The gameboard showing 5 compartments each illustrating a sailing ship. 5 large cards also showing the same ships. 35 small cards representing the captain, pilot and cargo of each ship.

When a player has played all his cards, he is out of the game and may lay his ship and cards aside. If it should happen that only two players remain at the last, the winning player sweeps the board, that is takes all the counters in the five compartments.

Name: British Sovereigns or The Circle of English History
Description:
A puzzle of 37 non interlocking pieces, hand cut, hand coloured lithograph with back covered with cream paper and 88 cards from a set of 90.

The pieces form a gameboard showing kings and queens in two concentric circles of 36 numbered areas. In each corner is a design of roses, thistles and shamrocks. In the centre is a disc giving the title and maker's details on a pink ground. The cards give details of each monarch from William I to Queen Victoria.

Published in London.

Name: Busy Bee
Description: A little luck and skill are needed for this game but it also trains colour recognition and memory. The two different ways of playing this game offer variety and plenty of fun. The players take turns pushing the bees into the slots in the beehive. As soon as a bee "flies out" the player takes it and puts it down on his/her card. Depending on which variant of the game is being played the winner is either the first player to fill his/her card with bees or the last to do. The players should sit side by side so that they can all see which bee is being pushed into which slot.

Name: Giuoco dei personaggi
Description:
Game characters

A race game with an oval track of 56 numbered squares, each with a named illustration and a central illustration showing a pair of men battling in front of a building. Three corners are filled with a triangle showing a floral pattern; the fourth, lower left, shows a building.

Published in Venice, Italy.

Name: Special Forces: Modern Military Boardgame
Description:
Special Forces, the world of the guerrilla warfare operative, allowing you to take control of a team of these highly trained operators as they under take missions behind enemy lines.

Players have the option to use a team of operators from a well known and respected regiment or customise their own team.  The board comprises of a base section onto which building tiles are placed based on the layouts found in the ‘Missions and Scenarios’ book.  After that it is up to the player to decide the best way to complete their objectives.  All players take control of the special forces operatives or operators working together to complete the aims of the mission at hand.

Name: Fleet
Description:
Fleet is a space battle between small fleets for 2-5 players using 1-2 Treehouse sets and a few coins.

Players move 3 or 5 (depending on the setup) Icehouse ships around on the surface, in an attempt to out-maneuver and destroy their opponents. Larger ships can move farther than smaller ships and take more damage to destroy. Use the black hole, wormhole, and special weapon to your advantage against your enemies. Last fleet standing is the winner.

Fleet was designed by Josh Cole. The full rules are available at http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Fleet

Name: Planet Earth Board Game
Description:
From http://www.catchoftheday.com.au/smallfish_info.php?products_id=5038:

Explore, discover & learn about our world!

What are cicadas- insects, plants or animals? Antarctica is in which hemisphere- Northern or Southern? An elephant's tusks are actually teeth- true or false? A interactive game the whole family can enjoy, and test your knowledge as you roll the dice and journey around the board in the Planet Earth Board Game.

* Featuring stunning imagery and incredible facts
    * Explore, discover and learn more about Planet Earth
    * Educational and fun to play
    * Includes game board, player tokens, 55 question cards, dice and player guide

Correctly answer questions about the unique regions of our planet and be the first player with three tokens on home region spaces to win the game. But watch out, other players will be trying to swap their tokens with yours!

Name: Relic Raiders: Mystic Tower and the Book of Spells
Description:
User Summary:

This is a 3D pop-up game that requires no assembly, yet allows the pathways to be moved during play.  Find the ancient relic and escape while avoiding the monsters that dwell within.  Of course, monsters can be persuaded to pursue your opponents, instead.  Player and monster movement is determined by playing cards, just as in its sister game, Relic Raiders: Haunted Ruins.

Name: World's Greatest Party Game
Description:
Acting, Searching, Drawing, Creating! More ways to have fun at a party than you can shake a stick at!

Incredible Value -- three complete games in one box

Drawing Game: with a twist -- everyone draws (no special skill necessary) amd all players are involved with the game at all times.

Charades Game: has categories with outrageous content leading to great fun for all.

Scavenger Hunt -- game allows everyone to get up and have fun while creating things and finding stuff in and around the house

Back of box.

A die roll determines the nature of the challenge,  This collection offers charades, scavenger hunt and an unusual drawing game in which people try to guess what a player is going to choose to draw from a short list of terms.

Name: World's Greatest Word Game
Description:
A Fabulous Game for Everyone who Loves Words -- Includes Word Poker, Word Scramble, and Word Builder

Combines three fantastic word games:

Word Scramble: Everyone works at once building as many words as possible using communal letter tiles.  Player at the end with the most words wins the game -- fast and furious fun.

Word Builder: Build off other players words and be the first to run out of letters dealt -- play speeds up as the game progresses making for a fun and hectic finish.

Word Poker: Make the best poker hand you can while building words at the same time.  Best hand wins unless you can out bluff your opponents during betting.  Great combination of play in an incredibly fun game.

Name: Sushi Panic!
Description:
A dexterity balance game along the lines of Buckaroo. Draw a card, place the correct piece of plastic sushi on the unsteady table and if your hand wasn't steady enough KABOOOOM the table flips sending the sushi everywhere!
Quick, easy and with fun, colourful and chunky sushi pieces.

- User summary

Name: Verbal Volley Middle School Expansion Pack
Description:
An expansion to Verbal Volley, with 172 conceptual vocabulary words.

Players ply for eachother of within teams. Players come up with synonyms or antonyms. It's a race against the clock.

Name: Mentirosa
Description:
Mentirosa© is a version of liar's dice that is played with Spanish Poker dice and the exclusive Mentirosa Player Tubes available only in this timeless game set.

The object of the game is to guess what your opponents have rolled without going over.

Unlike traditional poker games that require a poker face and mostly silence, Mentirosa encourages you to trash talk, taunt and tease your opponents. It's the main strategy, hence the name of the game: Mentirosa (Spanish: liar).

EACH SET INCLUDES:

* 6 Mentirosa Player's Tubes
    * 6 sets of casino-grade poker dice
    * Loser Chips : These chips will help you keep track of the winners and losers.
    * Mentirosa Professional or Travel storage case
    * Instructions in English and Spanish.

2 to 20 Players (with extra sets) Ages 10 and up.


How to play Mentirosa

In this version of liar's dice, the object of the game is to guess the number rolled, of any suit, among all the dice.

To begin the game, each player rolls a single die in open view of other players. The player
with the highest suit starts the play. If a tie occurs, only those players in the tie roll again.

Players throw five poker dice into their tube. They look in their tube to see what they rolled.

A turn begins when the starting a player makes a call, for example three Jacks. This
means they believe that there are at least three Jacks among all the dice in play.

The next player has two options:

1. Raise the call. This is done by, raising the suit called, raising the number of dice
      called, or both. In this example, the next player could call three Queens, three
      Kings, three Aces, or four of anything else. Any of these would be higher than the
      three Jacks called. Or...

2. Challenge the call. When a player challenges a call, he or she does not believe
      that the hand called, in this case three Jacks, exists among all the dice in play.
      To challenge, a player raises their tube, revealing their hand and signaling to the
      other players to do the same. At this point, the suit in play is counted.

In this example, if there are at least three Jacks among all the dice in play, the
challenger receives a loser chip and a new turn begins. If there are less than three Jacks among the dice in play, the calling player receives a loser chip and a new turn begins.

The loser begins the next turn. There is no passing. Once a call is raised, it is the next player’s turn and he or she has the same two options.The game continues in this manner, player after player, until a call is challenged.

Once a player receives 5 loser chips, they are out of the game. Last man standing wins!

Source: www.mentirosa.org

Name: Panzer
Description:
User Summary:
One of Gamecraft's Pocket Wars games. A series of short, simple 2-player Abstract Strategy wargames.

This game has players moving their force of 5 'panzer' tokens toward each other in a head-to-head manner along the 5 columns of the game board.

Name: ULTIMATE COMBO: Boxing
Description:
It's a card game that simulates a boxing match. Both players draw cards from a single pile. Every card represents an specific action (jab, hook to the body, duck, clinch, etc) that can be linked to another action (jab-cross-left hook...) or countered by specific actions. The round lenght is commanded by the number of cards left in the pile. The match ends when one of the boxer's stamina reach zero (you lose one stamina point for every  punch you get), or by instant KO (one KO punch) or TKO (three knockdowns in a single round).
There are 8 diferent types of punch, 4 dodge moves + 2 cancel moves making a total of 14!!! possible actions per boxer. AND aditionally you can play it with a board adding even more moves and strategy.

Name: Chariot Arena
Description:
Chariot Arena is a Grim Trojan board game based on the chariot races of Roman times and the first of Grim Trojan’s Downloadable Board Games.

To keep the game fun for different levels and ages of players, optional rules have been created (the alternate rules follow the official rules).

This board game is very loosely based on historical records about chariot races. With that said, never forget the game is a board game and as such has been modified to keep game play fun. The arena is based (again, loosely) on Rome’s largest and oldest circus, Circus Maximus (called a circus because of the oval shape).

Attacks are allowed to simulate the whipping and bumping that occurred in a chariot race and the curves are more dangerous in the board game because they were in the real races.

Chariot Arena has two different playing boards to allow for better game play. The larger board comprised of four pages
with smaller hexes was designed for a larger group of players and for those who enjoy longer more detailed game play. The
smaller board comprised of two pages with larger hexes is designed to allow a smaller number of players to have more
interaction in few laps and its charts are less complicated. Try both and play the one that best suits your style of play.

As each player takes their turn, they must first move their pawn 6 hexes. They then have the option to stay where they are or roll 2d6 (two six sided dice) and moving their pawn across the board one hex at a time the number of hexes shown on the dice. Movement can be forward left, forward right or forward. Moving a pawn backward on the track is not permitted. Only one
pawn can occupy a hex at a time. If a pawn is in your way, you must move around it. The player also has the option to move
the pawn less hexes than indicated on the dice (example: a player rolling 10 can move only 7 hexes if they wish). If a pawn’s path is blocked by other pawns and it is impossible to move forward while moving the base 6 hexes, the player must choose which pawn to stop behind. The player and the owner of the other pawn must both roll from the Accident Chart.

Name: Chaos Crossing
Description:
Description from game pdf

Chaos Crossing is a game for 2 to 4 players. This game requires Pegable Pawns: 4 blue, 4 red, 4 orange, 4 yellow, 1 green, 1 grey, 1 white, 1 brown, 1 purple; 1 game board; 1 six sided die.

The object of the game is to send all of your pawns out onto the board to collect crowns and be the first to return all of your pawns, crowned, to the starting sphere.

Name: Balloons in the Wind
Description:
Description from game pdf

Balloons In The Wind can be played by any number of players, but one player might not be very challenging and anything over eight might begin to get a little crowded. Grim Trojan recommends using the Ball Pawns for this game (just because they look good for it. Any pawn that fits in the grid’s squares will work).

The winner is the first player to cross the red line into the park at the North end of the board.

Name: British Sovereigns
Description:
This boardgame includes 56 pictures of British kings and queens from Egbert (died 839), the first English king, to Victoria (1819–1901).

The players are provided with a Card, containing nine Letters, nine Numbers, two Crosses and one Blank, which are to be cut up on the lines with a pair of scissors.

Each player, on drawing a number, is to place his letter on the same number in the Game. When it is his turn to draw another, he adds them together and advances his letter to that number which they make when so added, reading as before, and observing any directions which may be given him. But if he draw a cross, he is to draw again, till he obtain a number, which number is to be deducted from, instead of added to his former station, and his letter moved back accordingly. Each card to be returned to the bag after drawing. Whoever draws a blank, remains at his former number. After each player has drawn once, the boardgame is to be continued in the same manner, passing the bag round, till someone makes up the exact number 151, who wins the Game.

Name: Wakfu
Description:
Wakfu is a French Collectible Card Game, named after the Massive Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game that reimplements Dofus.

Each player controls a hero, among 12 that have different stats and abilities, and a dimensional bag, in which 4 cards are safe.

A turn consists in playing new cards from hand to put new characters, equipment or zones in play, and performing one single attack against one single target. The defending player may block the attack with his own characters.

Cards, once in play, can be used either as resources to put new cards in play, or to activate their special abilities, or to attack. Either way, when used they are rotated and are not available until next turn. A rotated card may not be used to block the opponent's attack.

After each attack, some experience points may be awarded to either player. The heroes may level up when they reach 6 experience points, and again when they reach 18 experience points. There are two possible ways to win: either kill the opponent's hero, or level up twice with one's own.

Free translation from the back of the starter box:
Chose your hero and his dimensional bag and explore the world of Dofus and Wakfu. Develop your crafting skills, create powerful items, feed your pets and earn XP... create your own ideal game! Tournament play is awaiting you...

Name: Téte de la Course
Description:
Game, in which authors took a job to simulate cycling. The main game takes place in France on the Tour, on one track between Brest - Plumelec. Other side of the board is a timed circuit with completely new rules.
Each player takes care of one team (one colour) and moves his vehicles according to the dice throw. There are 3 types of terrain - down (dice throw x3), straight (dice throw x2) and hills (dice throw).
A few places behind you rides also your service vehicle, which can help in case of a defect (when you throw a six, there is a chance of defect).
Each player has also a pack of cards, which he can use in the race to speed up his cyclist for a couple of dice throws. 
There are also fights for the yellow and striped dresses, which gives player advantages in next race. Weather has also influence on racer movement and is simulated randomly with a short forecast by a PC small program.

Name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye
Description:
Game takes place in Radiator Springs, a town created by a Pixar animation studios movie Cars. 
Game is mainly for smaller children. The principle is simple: you create one of three possible race tracks (assembles as puzzle) as throw dice to be the first in the finish. 
Many obstacles comes in your way: you must draw cards, you lose few turns or you have to go back by a few spots. Each tile is home of one of movie characters.
On the race track can be up to 6 cars made of plastic, but they are looking good. You have to assemble them first.

Name: Princezny na plese
Description:
Game for little girls. You place pink cardboard hearts in a circle and in the middle you place another six blue hearts to form another, closer circle. 
Four princesses take turns and run around on the outer circle, turn the hearts and find things as a lost dress, and so on. They have to find four pieces of clothing before they can go to the ball and find their prince. There are many obstacles in their way (a birdie,...).
When they are dressed, they step into the inner circle and are trying to find their prince (only one of the four is the right one for each princess).

Name: Matador: Et spørgsmålsspil om Korsbæk
Description:
The game is based on the highly popular television series "Matador", which was shown on Danish television in the eighties. It is not necessary to have followed the series, but the pleasure is greater if you have a little knowledge of the history and characters you will meet on the gameboard.
The game is about to correctly answering questions, collect the right number of cards and reach the goal, before the other players steals your cards. In addition to knowledge about the persons in Matador, their intrigue and relationships, you also need to play tactical, and to be part of the "right" alliances to win the game.
The game contains 1200 questions about the series and its personalities, and all question-cards are in addition to the 4 questions for adults, marked with a question, especially developed for children, (8 years), thus without a greater understanding of 'Matador' can participate on equal terms with grownups.

Name: Amusement in English History
Description:
At this gameboard portraits of 40 British kings and queens, in 80 playing spaces altogether, are shown with events from each of their reigns.

Rules:
The Card sold with the Game is to be divided. The Letters are to mark the players' position on the Game; the Numbers and Blanks are to be placed in a lady's reticule or bag. Draw for the first player; the highest number to begin. Each player on drawing a number is to place his letter on the same number on the Game, unless otherwise ordered in the directors, which must be read aloud. When it is his turn to draw again, he must add his number to the one where his letter stands, and remove it accordingly. If he draws a blank, he must remain where he is. Each card is to be returned to the bag. The game is to proceed in this manner till some player arrives at the Marriage of Queen Victoria, who wins the game. When a player is sent back, he is not to read the Directions, but wait his turn to draw again. The history of each reign may be read or omitted at the time of playing, as the players think fit.

Name: The Cottage of Content or the Blessings of Cheerfulness & Good Temper
Description:
A card game and a moral game and described on the front of the box as follows: "Showing how Good Dr Lovejoy did invite a party and award his nice Cottage of Content to Master Peter Placid and Miss Felicia Amiable and how it was their happy lot to be the means of converting their friends from their errors".

The game is to continue until all are placed upon the table. Then Dr. Lovejoy will give the Cottage of Content to Peter Placid and Felicia Amiable as a reward for their excellent behaviour, which had promoted so much mirth and good feeling amonst his party of visitors.

Name: Floating Fortress
Description:
Floating Fortress is a Print-n-Play game featuring a navel battle between two players using standard d6 dice. The game is played on a 8x8 board with each player having 2 bases and 14 ships under their control. Each turn a player may move a single ship or use multiple ships to fire on a single target. Ships have to reload their ammunition between shots and are controlled with attack and defense dice that determine their shots power, their movement speed, their firing range and how much life they have remaining. The object of the game is to be the first player to eliminate both of their opponent's bases.

The game requires each player to have their own set of 36 dice with the 2 sets being a different color and it can played on the back of the unfolded rulebook. The rulebook and board fit on a single sheet of printed paper.

Name: The Travellers of Europe, with Improvements and Additions
Description: Five players take the parts of The Travellers, who are from Austria, Sweden, Russia, Prussia and England. They must make their way to their respective capital cities each starting from a different city in Africa, or on the shore of the Mediterranean Sea. They play with a teetotum or spinner with four sides marked N,S,E,W representing the directions they must move in.

Name: Cognes
Description:
A game for 2 players (and possibly 3 or 4) requiring only a bunch of coins and a plane, non-slippery surface. Perfect for situations where no other game is at hand!

On their turn, each player tries to flip a coin, while always maintaining it in contact with the table, without it ever touching another coin.

Name: The Pirate and Traders of the West Indies
Description:
The gameboard consists of 8 sections mounted on linen and showing a map of the Caribbean. The title is at the top and the publisher's details at the lower left. It shows a map of the Caribbean islands together with shipping and latitude and longitude lines.

THE TRADERS are supposed to be trading between the West India Islands and other countries, and are about to start on their voyage from certain places on the coast of Mexico and in the Caribbean sea. These places are indicated by the four letters A,B,C,D, and each trader has a mark corresponding with one of these letters.

The PIRATE, who is to attack or capture the traders on their voyage, has his retreat marked on the coast near to New Orleans, and from this spot he starts at the beginning of the game.

Name: PrincessOpoly
Description:
A little girl said, "I’m a princess!" 
Her big brother said, "You can’t be a princess! You’re not from
a royal family!" She just smiled, and knew better.

All it takes is a crown, and a little imagination!
From the Late For the Sky website:

Princess-opoly celebrates the imagination in all little girls. Players collect princess friends, give those friends a crown, and collect extra allowance each time another player lands on their space. (Yes, even a princess needs to earn an allowance!)

Modern day princesses are about A LOT more than finding Prince Charming. Princess-opoly celebrates strong girls with big personalities, and even BIGGER dreams!

So, grab your wand and advance to "Imagine!"

Get ready for an ENCHANTING experience!

Name: Quatre Bras: Oportunidad perdida?
Description:
Quatre Bras - Oportunidad perdida? (Spanish: "Quatre Bras - Lost oportunity ?") is a Spanish Wargame on the battle of Quatre Bras (16 June 1815).

This is an hex-and-counter game that uses the Sombra del Águila (Shadow of the Eagle) system rules.

The board hexes are numered as to facilitate the initial positioning of counters and victory points.
The counters represent units, leaders, formations and events, and are printed so that could be glued and cut.

The board and counter sheets are available with the spanish magazine Wargames; Soldados y Estratégias nº 46.

Game System:
- scale = 250m hex; 
- time = 20 min/GT; 
- strength = battaillons (inf), regiments (cav), batteries (art).
Families: Series: The Shadow of the Eagle

Name: França Antártica
Description:
Brazilian postcard print-and-play wargame about the french attacks in Brazil on the 16 century.

Small, easy to print, learn and play, the games last 8 turns each divided in 3 phases (Initiative, movement, combat) in which the objective of the French/Indian player is to take the fort, and the Portuguese player to prevent it.

The board represents no specific place but a generic battleground.

Counters are divided in Portuguese, French and Indians.
It requires 2 d6 dice.

Name: Quadrant Z
Description:
OBJECTIVE

The objective of the game is to conquer the galaxy - either by occupying the most stars; or by capturing the opponent's home base star, or by destroying the opponent's forces.

SET UP

Each player should draw a 10 by 10 grid. Each set of adjacent 4 squares is grouped into a quadrant, and labeled from A to Y, starting from the top, left hand side quadrant. Each square in a quadrant is numbered from 1 to 4, starting from the top, left hand side square.

One player is allocated the 6 quadrant in the top-left hand side of the board as his home sector, and the other takes the 6 quadrant in the bottom-right hand side of the board as his. The remaining 13 quadrants form the neutral sector. The corner quadrants in each player's home sector are their respective home quadrants.

Each player receives 45 points to create stars in the galaxy.

Quadrat Z is very much a game of cat-and-mouse. As in many wars, you have some idea of an opponent's strength and general location, but very little about the exact composition and location of his forces. Hence, the value of intelligence gathering should not be underrated.

Strategy will vary from game to game, but a major focus should be on the capture of stars: without them your forces will not grow, and , in the long run their lack will certainly cause you to lose. Think carefully about the initial layout of stars, and place your ships to capture the maximum number of points as soon as possible. Try and maintain a balanced force of ship sizes. Movement is hidden, and fairly rapid shifts of forces from one quadrant to another are possible. Remember that in combat the aim is to have the largest combined force - not necessarily a single, high value ship. A single, large strike ship may penetrate enemy lines and take out the opponent's home base... but if he sees it coming he may have time to regroup and knock it out. Spreading your ships out too thinly in a quadrant could also be problematic in combat.

Name: Pax Romana
Description:
Game included in Vae Victis 91
Pax Romana is a small game about the defense of Roman empire. It can be played solo or in teams of players. this game is designed to allow players to search for the best option between defending and expending the Roman Empire.

Contains:
1 A4 map
73 counter to cut and mount
2 pages rule

Name: Inspector Rabbit
Description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

In Inspektor Hase, players use their rabbit inspectors to hunt down crooks – but every crook has a twin, and you can arrest a crook only when you can nab the pair of them.

How do you catch the crooks? When one of your rabbit inspectors lands in a search area, you can turn the two face-down tokens located there face up. Plop another rabbit into a second search area which turns out to have a matching crook, and you can claim the two of them. Depending on the number of players, the first person to capture three or four pairs of crooks wins.

Name: Hasenjagd
Description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Hasenjagd ("Rabbit Hunt" in English) has players take turns moving a rabbit through the grass, trying to avoid foxes along the way. The hare card that a player chooses uses arrows to show where the rabbit moves – and if you can't lay hare cards to move the rabbit to safety, then you're out of the round. Hop the right way, and you'll run away with the golden carrot.

Name: Final Cup
Description:
Final Cup is a simple Dice Soccer game.
There is no ball in the game, the players are moved by a single 6-sided die. Once a player reaches the other teams goal a goal is scored.
The game was published in the GDR.

Name: The Chronological Star of the World: An Entertaining Game
Description:
The gameboard showing a circle with a star pattern of 8 large points alternating with 8 small points, with crescent and star shapes. With a ribbon pattern around outer edge. No. of squares: 109, all illustrated and numbered.

The game is played anti-clockwise with No. 1 at the bottom of the point which is in the central position at the bottom of the game. The first 24 are alternately the points and the ribbon illustrations around the outer edge. Nos. 25 to 56 combine the second illustration in the large points, the first illustration in the small points and the illustrations in the stars and crescents. These two designs are in the spaces between the points and form an alternating pattern of two crescents, two stars. The rest of the numbers are shown on the points and around the central illustration which is dedicated to the Abolition of Slavery.

Name: The Infant's Cabinet of Fishes
Description: Wooden box with sliding lid that has an illustration of a fishbowl containing three fish on a table in a garden. The box contains cards and a small booklet. The booklet is titled A History of Fishes Volume II and has descriptions of 30 fish. The fish cards each have a hand coloured etching of a fish with its name and a reference to where it appears in the History of Fishes. Also on the card is the publisher's name and address and date of publication, October 3rd 1801.

Name: Civil War Trivia Board Game
Description:
A game of Civil War trivia played across a map of the U.S. and C.S.A. with lead figures. It uses a mix of wargaming and trivia to reproduce the American Civil War.

Players each have 3 armies. On a players turn they will roll the dice, march an army, and answer a question. As a bonus to answering a question correctly, an Active Move is earned. An incorrect answer always ends a players turn. Battles are fought when players end their turn with their armies in the same space as the other player. The game ends when one player holds 5 key positions in the West and Eastern theaters.

Action Moves
a) Raise the Colors
b) Travel by Rail
c) Travel by Water
d) Draw a Travel Card
e) Parole an Army

From the Creators
Civil War Trivia Board Game was produced with the Civil War enthusiast in mind. Based upon actual personalities and events of the Civil War era, it stands as a unique concept of trivia and strategy. So...make yourself Comfortable, General, and prepare to meet the enemy...

Name: Battle of Anegawa
Description:
"ç‡ƒãˆã‚ˆï¼å§‰å·ã®æˆ¦ã„ (Burn! Battle of Anegawa)"

The issue game covers the early important battle of Oda Nobunaga, with his ally Tokugawa, against the Azai-Asakura alliance.

The game is a grand tactical combat game.  It emphasizes on initiative and army morale. The mechanics accelerates the collapse of losing army dramatically.

Game components:

    8 page rulebook
    150 counters
    1 map

Name: Satsuma Rebellion 1877
Description:
This game covers the last battle around Meiji-Ishin.
One of the important Bakumatsu people, Takamori Saigoh decided to make a revolt in his home area, Satsuma (Kagoshima) in 1877 against his old friends and partners inside Meiji government.
The map covers the whole Kyushu island and uses point to point system.
The game has only 48 counters.  This is a small second game, but players can focus the important strategic decisions.
The victory is basically determined by Saigoh's end.
Historically he killed himself in the middle of his losing battle.
But, in this game, if Saigoh player cleverly play the game, there's a chance of bloody stalemate which means that he can propose some of his desire to the government for this revolt.
Families: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

Name: War Unleashed: Volume 1
Description:
From the official WarriorElite newsletter (summarized):

War Unleashed - the companion to War for Edath.

Battlefield rules - now you can battle over large battlefields for the full tabletop, battlegame experience where strategy in deployment and movement is key - many Terrain Maps (battlefields) will be available free to download online & others will be included in future expansion packs.
  
The Art of War - campaign rules where you'll compete over a region of Edath. Includes gaining experience and 'leveling up' troops, champions & leaders. 
  
The Art of the Master - expanded rules for Combat & Battle Masters that unleash their true potential. Includes skills and is the basis for having characters in your games.
  
Background on the World of Edath is also contained within War Unleashed. A map, history, world details, Edath's species, the warring factions, countries of Edath, the Dzaa Empire & the Supernatural - including magic - are all covered.

War Unleashed comes in paperback, A5 format - 144 fully illustrated pages and an 8 page, full-colour section of artwork.

Name: Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game
Description:
Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game (
è£…ç”²é¨Žå…µãƒœãƒˆãƒ ã‚º ã‚¶ ãƒãƒˆãƒªãƒ³ã‚° ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ) is a collectible card game inspired by events in the anime of the same name.

Game-play focuses on the competitors in the Astradan empire's premier bloodsport: Armored Trooper (AT) Battling.

Be the first to exhaust your opponent's deck in an effort to destroy their AT and take your place among Uoodo's finest.

Name: Bigbep Hockey
Description:
BigBep Hockey is designed to play quickly while providing accurate statistics. But most of all, the game is designed to feel like hockey and provide the gamer with an enjoyable and immersive experience.

BigBep Hockey utilizes a Fast Action Deck and a Fast Results deck to greatly enhance the speed of play. The vast majority of all results are found without consulting outside charts. Once you have learned the rules, contests in BigBep hockey fly by.

While the game plays rapidly, this isn’t a watered down hockey game, nor is it a quick-play game. This is a full-fledged simulation of hockey. In BigBep Hockey each skater is rated for the following: Shooting from various places on the ice, Power Play ability, Penalty Killing ability, Overall Offensive contribution, Overal Defensive Contribution, shots allowed, intimidation, passing, face-offs, injury frequency, times penalized, and a clutch rating. Goalies are also rated for both home and away performance. BigBep Hockey truly captures the entire game of hockey.

The board game includes complete rules, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Action Cards, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Result Charts, and all charts, printed in full-color, that are needed to play the game.
